body_html: Yes, I'd looked at #2757 (comment) however that one concerns to exception occuring in DataLoaderIter.__del__ while this one if for StorageRef.__del__. Also I think former happens after program ends and GC tries to do cleanup while this one occurs while program is still running and probably more serious.
body_text: Yes, I'd looked at #2757 (comment) however that one concerns to exception occuring in DataLoaderIter.__del__ while this one if for  StorageRef.__del__. Also I think former happens after program ends and GC tries to do cleanup while this one occurs while program is still running and probably more serious.
body: Yes, I'd looked at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/2757#issuecomment-341752166 however that one concerns to exception occuring in `DataLoaderIter.__del__` while this one if for  `StorageRef.__del__`. Also I think former happens after program ends and GC tries to do cleanup while this one occurs while program is still running and probably more serious.
